Class AbstractCart<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractCart<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - -Type of items that will be placed in the Cart.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AmazonCart

    public abstract class AbstractCart<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    The Abstract Cart class represents a user's cart. Items of Type T can be added or removed from the cart. A hashmap is used to keep track of the number of items that have been added to the cart example 2 apples or 4 shirts.
    Author:
    Your friendly CS Profs

        public abstract double calculateTotal()

      • addItem

        public void addItem(T item)
        Add an item of type T to the Cart (HashMap: The product is the key and the value is the count). If product doesn't exist in the cart add it and set count to one. Otherwise increment the value.
        Parameters:
        item -

      • addItems

        public void addItems(java.util.ArrayList<? extends T> items)
        Adds every item in the Arraylist of Type T or any subclass of T.
        Parameters:
        items: - An array of items

      • removeItem

        public boolean removeItem(T item)
        Removes an item of type T from the list. If the only one item, we remove that item. If item count is greater than one decrement the count. If you are able to remove the item then return true. If the item doesn't exist return false.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:
        true in the list.

      • removeItems

        public void removeItems(java.util.ArrayList<? extends T> items)
        Removes all of the item of items of Type T or any subclass of T from the cart.
        Parameters:
        item -

      • contains

        public boolean contains(T item)
        Check to see if the cart contains an item.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:
        true if cart contains the item. Returns False otherwize
